name: GetIncidentAnalytics
description:
Fetch enriched incident metrics and data from PagerDuty Analytics.

Use this tool to retrieve detailed metrics and data for multiple incidents, such as Seconds to Resolve and Sleep Hour Interruptions. A `team_ids` or `service_ids` filter is needed for certain API keys.

parameters.name: accept_version_header
parameters.description: Specifies the version of the API to use, set via the `Accept` header. This controls the format and version of the returned data.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the request body. For this endpoint, use 'application/json'.

parameters.name: incident_analytics_parameters
parameters.description: Parameters and filters for the dataset, including filters like creation date range and urgency. Use team_ids or service_ids for certain keys.

created_at_start.description: Filters the result, showing only the incidents where the creation timestamp is greater than or equal to the filter value.

created_at_end.description: Filters the result, showing only the incidents where the creation timestamp is less than the filter value.

updated_after.description: Filters the result, showing only incidents where the updated_at value is greater than the filter value.

urgency.description: Filters the result, showing only the incidents where urgency matches the filter value.

major.description: An incident is classified as a [major incident](https://support.pagerduty.com/docs/operational-reviews#major-incidents) if it has one of the two highest priorities, or if multiple responders are added and acknowledge the incident.

team_ids.description: An array of team IDs. Only incidents that are assigned to a member of these teams will be returned. Account must have the teams ability to use this parameter.

service_ids.description: An array of service IDs. Only results related to these services will be returned.

priority_ids.description: The priority_ids filter applied to the results.

priority_names.description: The priority_names filter applied to the results.

incident_type_ids.description: Filter incidents by specific incident type IDs. Only incidents matching the given IDs will be returned.

filters.description: Filters the result, only show incidents that match the conditions passed in the filter.

starting_after.description: A cursor to indicate the reference point that the results should follow

ending_before.description: A cursor to indicate the reference point that the results should precede

order.description: The order the results;  asc for ascending, desc for descending. Defaults to 'desc'.

order_by.description: The column to use for ordering the results. Defaults to 'created_at'.

limit.description:
Number of results to include in each batch.
Limits between 1 to 1000 are accepted.

time_zone.description: The time zone to use for the results.

value_schema.description: Parameters and filters to apply to the dataset.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.
